abstract: Speaking at the AllThingsD D10 conference on Wednesday, Mary Meeker, a former Morgan Stanley analyst, described Facebook’s initial public offering as a “financial tsunami,” but placed most of the blame on the string of technical problems that affected Facebook’s stock on its first day of trading.
snippet: Speaking at the AllThingsD D10 conference on Wednesday, Mary Meeker, a former Morgan Stanley analyst, described Facebook’s initial public offering as a “financial tsunami,” but placed most of the blame on the string of technical problems that affe...
lead_paragraph: Mary Meeker, a partner of Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, does not blame the bankers for Facebook’s bungled debut.

headline.main: Technical Trading Issues to Blame for Facebook’s Fall, Meeker Says

abstract: The performer, who admits fabricating parts of his own reporting on working conditions in China, attacked the All Things D conference for going easy on Apple’s Tim Cook.
snippet: The performer, who admits fabricating parts of his own reporting on working conditions in China, attacked the All Things D conference for going easy on Apple’s Tim Cook.
lead_paragraph: Mike Daisey was last seen apologizing for exaggerations and falsehoods in his influential one-man show “The Agony and Ecstasy of Steve Jobs” about the working conditions at the Chinese factories that make many Apple devices.

headline.main: Mike Daisey Returns to the Apple Story, With Journalists as Targets
